column2: In proletarian dictatorships, land and property are governed by appointed or elected Party officials.
In a dictatorial realm, the Politburo convenes to select an appropriate successor from their members, the ruler’s relatives, or the heads of the regions that directly report to them..
In communal realms, land and property are owned collectively and represented by local delegates.
Under communal succession, delegates from all across the realm convene to select their preferred candidate.
[Root.GetFirstName] follows the School of the Sickle
